Content.Paragraph: This document outlines a pre-ride inspection checklist for mountain bikes, designed to ensure safety and optimal performance. It is based on the provided DModule and is intended for use by riders before each ride.
Content.Heading: I. Introduction
Content.Paragraph: This checklist covers key components of a mountain bike. Regular inspection and maintenance are crucial for a safe and enjoyable riding experience.
Content.Heading: II. Inspection Checklist
A. Brakes

Item.Content: Check for wear and tear. Replace if necessary.
Ensure smooth operation and proper adjustment.
Inspect for fraying, kinks, or leaks.

Content.Heading: B. Tires

Item.Content: Inflate to the recommended pressure based on terrain:
Inspect for cracks, splits, or embedded objects.

Content.Heading: C. Wheels

Item.Content: Ensure the wheel spins without significant wobble.
Verify all spokes are present and tight.

Content.Heading: D. Headset
E. Chain

Item.Content: Ensure smooth movement and proper lubrication.

Content.Heading: F. Handlebar & Stem

Item.Content: Inspect for cracks. **If cracked, replace immediately.**
Confirm stem and handlebar clamp bolts are securely tightened. **If handlebars twist in the stem, tighten the clamp bolt.**

Content.Heading: G. Computer (if equipped)
III. Warnings & Cautions

ListItem.Content: Do not ride with a cracked stem.
Always replace a cracked stem immediately.

Content.Heading: IV. Additional Notes

ListItem.Content: This checklist is a general guide. Consult your bike manufacturer's manual for specific recommendations.
Regular maintenance and professional servicing are recommended to ensure optimal performance and safety.
Adjust this inspection to your riding conditions and skill level.
